description: LaVar Ball says he hopes the Boston Celtics don't draft Lonzo Ball with the No. 1 overall pick.
title: LaVar Ball guarantees the Lakers will make the playoffs with Lonzo Ball, reveals how his $495 shoe is selling | FOX Sports

author:
Nick Schwartz                    

                                    
                        @nick_schwartz
description: Cowherd explains why the Celtics won't stun the Lakers by taking Lonzo Ball No. 1.
title: Colin Cowherd: 6 reasons there's no chance the Celtics will draft Lonzo Ball | FOX Sports

description: No, LaVar Ball will not stop talking. Not until it gets him and his family everything they want, starting with oldest son Lonzo in a Lakers uniform.
title: How Lonzo and LaVar Ball figured out how to get -- and keep -- our attention

description: Boston has Isaiah Thomas so can pass on guards Markelle Fultz and Lonzo Ball
title: 2017 NBA Mock Draft: After winning top pick, Celtics go with Duke's Jayson Tatum

author: Josh Peter
description: The Lakers have the No. 1 pick in the NBA draft, and could become a home for Lonzo Ball.
title: LaVar Ball is about to get even louder now

description: Lonzo Ball's desire to play for the Lakers is so strong that he will not work out for other teams, his father, LaVar, told Lakers Nation.
title: Lonzo to work out for Lakers only, LaVar says

description: The Fox Sports 1 host isn't backing down after being dismissed by the father of Lonzo Ball. FS1 colleague Jason Whitlock offered his on-air support to Leahy.
title: Kristine Leahy addresses LaVar Ball comments: 'You can't come at me and disrespect me'

author: The Associated Press
description: LaVar Ball has upped the ante. The outspoken father of former UCLA star Lonzo Ball said Wednesday on Fox Sport 1's "The Herd with Colin Cowherd" that it will now cost a shoe company $3 billion to make a deal with his Big Baller Brand. "If they want to talk to me now, it just went up to $3 billion. Triple Bs â€” billion, billion, billion," LaVar said.
title: LaVar Ball ups shoe deal asking price to $3 billion

description: The '17 NBA Draft is incredibly deep, with all 30 first-round picks likely to produce for their teams sooner than later. Here's the lottery order and a first-round mock. 1. Boston Celtics: Markelle Fultz, PG, Washington (Freshman) 2. Los Angeles Lakers: Lonzo Ball, PG, UCLA (Freshman) 3. Philadelphia 76ers: Malik Monk, G, Kentucky (Freshman) 4. Phoenix Suns: Josh Jackson, SF, Kansas (Freshman) 5. Sacramento Kings: De'Aaron Fox, PG, Kentucky (Freshman) 6. Orlando Magic: Lauri Markkanen, PF, Arizona (Freshman) 7. Minnesota Timberwolves: Jonathan Isaac, F, Florida State (Freshman) 8. New York Knicks: Jayson Tatum, SF, Duke (Freshman) 9. Dallas Mavericks: Dennis Smith Jr., PG, North Carolina State (Freshman)
title: 2017 NBA mock draft and lottery results | FOX Sports
